author: jonny.derp

author: protolambda
content: first picture: total unslashed target stake accounted for of previous epoch, visualized per slot, as late attestations come in. Gap between lines = slower attestation inclusion

author: protolambda
content: second picture: the previous epoch source/target/head scoring, accounted for at each slot (instead of at epoch end, like normal rewards and justification processing do). Similarly for current epoch (of which the attestations roll over into previous epoch). Gap between lines = head attesters seeing different and/or delayed head blocks. I.e. network slowness and/or forking.

author: lagake.
content: Without being able to actually run a Prysm node, without delving too much into code - it seems like I never get enough suitable peers to start up my node with the Prysm client. How can I test the results of my attack script on the network? Rumor seems to indicate the network is up but that‚Äôs different than successful finality. Especially since the beaconChain link is down?

author: djrtwo
content:
Why can't you run a node?
You should be able to run any of the three nodes on any of the nets using the config files and commands suggested in the readme

author: djrtwo
content:
A node will be the best way to view the effects of the network. Im also happy to look at logs when you attack

Agreed an explorer would be very useful here but we cant address that next werk

author: djrtwo
content: What commands are you running? Did you set the bootnode via cli?

author: djrtwo
content:
Ah, <@604062686623432740>  poluted the dht and the net is small so it might be difficult to find more than one peer for a bit. Even so, just one should be sufficient to sync

Do you get one peer? Does your node appear to sync?

do you have the multiaddresses of those peers ? <@!291925846556540928>

content: so you only need 1 node to sync with the network

author: jonny.derp
content:
Here are the lighthouse and prysm ENRs and IPs:

author: jonny.derp
content:
> ^ It doesn't work with or without your advised flag and reading the cmd options that is the default bootnode address being passed to the Prysm beacon-chain client anyways... Ill keep playing around with it and let you know what ends up working.
<@!353602292567638020> 

You will have to fix the relative path, but this command works for me to run Prysm to join the attacknet.

```
./../../clients/prysm/prysm.sh beacon-chain --verbosity trace --min-sync-peers 1 \
--datadir ../../public-attacknets/attacknets/prysm-attack-0/lighthouse-tesnet \
--contract-deployment-block 3076295 \
--deposit-contract "0x0d9d6d3aa0791d3b3f4f489b46dcd2586c1011c4" \
--chain-config-file ../../public-attacknets/attacknets/prysm-attack-0/prysm_config.yaml \
--bootstrap-node enr:-LK4QCL3slk-CztmDMtKhCiu2XsuNgdUVknxI765rjNE50E2cWLApLYcyv32nyQU53FBMigIDWHV7Ls8KEbRjhqHCnECh2F0dG5ldHOIwBlip0TBbHKEZXRoMpDDVKVKAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhAN_hmeJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQMef-fQtsXp-Hs6BdBgL15k9GxSO8zqQsTeDNxAgTUHmYN0Y3CCIyiDdWRwgiMo \
--bootstrap-node enr:-LK4QP5zUSinQtDAsbza-AsYhPvZAfrTVCN0JsKE1ZDHZRZ1WDMn_wp3TL5beku4oyxueszQ8kBg4AeU95Rg4uQLYYcDh2F0dG5ldHOIkPA6pNAcLc2EZXRoMpDDVKVKAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhBLkzmaJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQIz9T_YmQTREJUHEGWzRuuvKtDkB90i1yge6_ciNPo0CIN0Y3CCIyiDdWRwgiMo \
--bootstrap-node enr:-LK4QNKA3SPtfWNjrhy4ZIISEuTtjCdHimqWKFoGAnEQbtOKDhVnvSGWqievaB3351aMgOelPvhq9FhlkjP20xAagGYCh2F0dG5ldHOI5SQvROWDABKEZXRoMpDDVKVKAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhCLtNS-Jc2VjcDI1NmsxoQMc-b0BGgmgBV4BVviYqOoQ2biftbMQ_9IWYSDFN-sr0oN0Y3CCIyiDdWRwgiMo \
--bootstrap-node enr:-LK4QIz2ts8vBmFvl4qagzyPIGwInrs-1YbdQPpVKCXDEcB3HExjuNx3E-nk63dEW30ZQycr39QkO2zXAZPUvjWbkLoCh2F0dG5ldHOIBs6QbYE7WKGEZXRoMpDDVKVKAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhBK3DPCJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQMLKPinmDnROP9TPUG0R-LdCpv-X9hxRS8G4rCrJ7hQuoN0Y3CCIyiDdWRwgiMo
```
